definition: to hold one's tongue/Shut up!
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)
mouth/beak/nozzle/spout (of teapot etc)/CL:張|张[zhang1],個|个[ge4]
lit. shut your mouth, move your legs (motto for losing weight)
pinyin: guan3 zhu4 zui3 mai4 kai1 tui3

sentences.english: Presumably, the only thing that will mollify Kyl and others would be new warheads.
sentences.chinese: 大概，唯一能讓卡爾和其他人住嘴的是新彈頭。

sentences.english: When Harlan goes to rescue Lisa, he finds her bound and gagged.
sentences.chinese: 哈倫發現莉莎被捆綁住並被東西塞住嘴，他解救了她。

definition: shut up/shut your mouth/stop talking
Shut up!/same as 閉上嘴巴|闭上嘴巴
to desist/to stop/to stay one's hand
to berate/to excoriate/to chide/also written 呵斥[he1 chi4]
to shout at sb to stop
stern voice
to berate/to excoriate/to chide/also written 喝斥[he1 chi4]
to utter/to give voice
to open one's eyes wide/to stare/to glare (at sb)/to scowl
to glower (at sb)/to cast an angry look
very fierce
(of yamen bailiffs etc) to walk ahead of an official, shouting at pedestrians to clear the way
variant of 呵斥[he1 chi4]
to open one's mouth (to speak, esp. to make a request)/to gape
to blurt out/to shout
talkative/to speak out of turn/to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/rumors fly
